page.title: 12Farming
page.content: Around Clovelly there are several farms of several hundred acres each, formed by the amalgamation of the many smaller farms of days gone by. Most are{dairy farms}, which produce silage, wheat, barley and oats grown for their winter fodder. Some hay is also cut when the weather allows. The{milk,}mostly from herds of 100+ Friesian cows, is collected in tankers and processed at the milk factory at Torrington. Many of the farms also keep sheep. One farm has many pigs and another fattens cattle. Most of the farms have one or more dogs and several cats.Farm manure is spread on the fields.
